title: Introducing: Kellen Malloy
body:
With two tracks online, clocking in at fifteen minutes in length between them, it’s fair to say that **Kellen Malloy** isn’t in the market for writing pop hits for star-eyed teenagers.

_Ocotillo I (Manic Route)_ and _Ocotillo II (Nite Fell)_ are taken from his upcoming debut LP **_[Iso](http://kellenmalloy.bandcamp.com/album/iso)_**, and paint a starkly intimidating yet wondrously beautiful picture. From the scarcely audible, muttered vocals to the industrial clanks and eerie scratches, there’s something vaguely detached about **Malloy**, as he builds soundscapes that place themselves somewhere between the ambient ponderings of **Tim Hecker** and the perfectly intertwined faux-sonnets of **Radiohead**.  in the _early hour the changes come and i told you to be careful of. _  
_this brain it runs fast and far. trip on bleeding eye. _

_i’m beginning to numb, need to hide. to the end and back i’m _  
_beginning to find this fear is just one lonely night._

With another eight tracks set to complete the release of **_Iso_**, this LA upstart is certainly one to keep an eye out for.
